alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, southeastern St. Tammany Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southern Hancock Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stennis Space Center, or 8 miles east of Slidell, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearlington, Stennis Space Center and Shoreline Park. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 264 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 12 between mile markers 82 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
